I have a million of electronic devices that work flawlessly on this network, so the problem are the devices. Check on the forums for "chromecast brain freeze" before buying it and you'll see. This problem has been an ongoing thing for over 2 months and Google didn't fix it, so keep in mind that that's the kind of "support" you will receive from them. They were great before the update ....

review: We have Apple TV, Roku, Fire, and Slingbox. We bought this because it was on sale and we wanted to work with a different interface. Roku and Apple TV work equally well for us so it depends on your brand of equipment and preference. Both have discrete remotes. Fire has a discrete remote but is very limited in apps and seems mainly another effort by Amazon to sell their content. Slingbox is for a different purpose although there are apps for it on most of these devices (recently Fire added one). I am not sure what the Chromecast (no remote) does that would make it stand out. It is boxed up and I'll give it to one of my kids.
